data.title: 4th Of July Fun Around North Dakota 2019
data.meta_description: Want to know more about Allison? Get their official bio, social pages and articles!
data.text:
Looking for family fun this 4th of July?

Here's what I found for you! Have a fun and safe holiday weekend....Allison

**Minot**

--The Dakota Territory Air Museum is proud to co-host the Spirit of the Plains Airshow on July 4 at the Minot International Airport featuring the Canadian Forces Snowbirds, WWII aircraft demonstrations, adrenaline pumping, first-class aerobatics, UAS (drone) demonstrations and more! Bring the whole family! Gates open at 2pm with airshow starting at 4pm! The event is FREE to the public!

-- Roosevelt Park: 9:30 am Patriotic Ceremony under park band shell. 11am to 3pm Celebration Festival with food & craft vendors, bouncy castles, yard games, Princess & Super Hero meet & greet with face painting.

--Minot fireworks display, Nodak Speedway 10:45 to 11:45 pm.

--4 Bears Yacht 4th of July yacht cruise sail time is 10:30 pm

**Bismarck**

-Bismarck Mandan Symphony Orchestra Concert located on the grounds of the North Dakota State Capitol, the event includes a performance by the symphony orchestra and a firework show after the concert. The display is widely considered the best in the entire state.

**Bottineau**

-July 3rd Water club de Skinautique Show & Fireworks/The Hill Lake Metigoshe 8pm start time.

--see image at the bottom of page

**Garrison**

--Garrison pet & doll parade 3:45pm

**Grand Forks**

--Sertoma 4th of July Festival & Fireworks Show starts at 11am at 2175 47th Ave S in Grand Forks

**Fargo**

-4th of July Celebration at Bonanzaville Noon to Midnight ---Activities include carnival games with fun prizes, train rides, kidsâ€™ games and crafts, historical recreations, horse-drawn wagon rides, live demonstrations, a parade, and a firework display.

**Mandan**

-Mandan Independence Day Parade 8am-1:30pm East Main Street Mandan

**Rugby**

-4th of July Parade 11:30am to 2:30pm

-Rugby car club cruise 6:15pm

**Starts & Stripes in Stanley North Dakota**

Nothing beats the 4th of July in the most charming of small towns, Stanley ND! The multi day event is packed with a 5k, games in the park, music from Dirty Word, parade, car show, inflatables, food and of course FIREWORKS! Brought to you by the Stanley Commercial Club with the help of local organizations/businesses!

July 4th-

Breakfast Served by Stanley's Boy Scouts

-7:30-8:15am 5K Registration

-8:30am 5K Run starts

-10:30am Kiddy Parade starts

-11am Main Parade starts

-12pm lunch served by Stanley Women of Today in the park

-1-4pm Open pool hours (free admission!)

-12pm Car show registration

-1-4pm Car Show

-1-4pm Vendor show

-Dusk Fireworks at the South Complex

July 5th-

12:30-1:30pm Corn Whole registration

-1:30pm Corn Whole starts

-2pm Sand volleyball Starts

-2pm Lip Sync Battle (preregistration through George Littlecreek)

-Food vendors will be serving all day

- 8:30pm-12pm Dirty Word Concert

**Williston**

-Fireworks display 10pm to 11:30pm Upper Missouri Valley Fairgrounds

**Velva**
